00029 ## @package pyp_nrm
00030 # pyp_nrm contains several procedures for computing numerator relationship matrices and for
00031 # performing operations on those matrices.  It also contains routines for computing CoI on
00032 # large pedigrees using the recursive method of VanRaden (1992).
00033 ##
00034 import copy, logging, numpy, string
00035 import pyp_utils
00036 #from pyp_newclasses import tail_recursive

00038 try:
00039     import psyco
00040     psyco.full()
00041 except ImportError:
00042     print '[INFO]: The psyco module could not be imported in pyp_nrm. Psyco speed optimizations are not available.'

00044 try:
00045     from pysparse import spmatrix
00046 except ImportError:
00047     #logging.info('Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse! Using NumPY dense matrices instead.')
00048     print '[INFO]: Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse in pyp_nrm! NumPY dense matrices will be used instead.'

00050 ##
00051 # a_matrix() is used to form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  DEPRECATED.
00052 # use fast_a_matrix() instead.
00053 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00054 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00055 # @retval The NRM as a NumPy matrix.
00056 def a_matrix(pedobj, save=0):
00057     """
00058     Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  DEPRECATED.
00059     """
00060     try: logging.info('Entered a_matrix()')
00061     except: pass
00062     l = pedobj.medata.num_records
00063     # Grab some array tools
00064     try:
00065         a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate dimension
00066         for row in xrange(l):
00067             for col in xrange(row,l):
00068                 # cast these b/c items are read from the pedigree file as characters, not integers
00069                 pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID)
00070                 pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID)
00071                 pedobj.pedigree[col].damID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID)
00072                 #if pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID == 0 and pedobj.pedigree[col].damID == 0:
00073                 if str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']) and str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00074                     if row == col:
00075                         # both parents unknown and assumed unrelated
00076                         a[row,col] = 1.
00077                     else:
00078                         a[row,col] = 0.
00079                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00080                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00081                     # sire unknown, dam known
00082                     if row == col:
00083                         a[row,col] = 1.
00084                     else:
00085                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1]
00086                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00087                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00088                     # sire known, dam unknown
00089                     if row == col:
00090                         a[row,col] = 1.
00091                     else:
00092                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1]
00093                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00094                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']) and str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00095                     # both parents known
00096                     if row == col:
00097                         a[row,col] = 1. + ( 0.5 * a[pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1] )
00098                     else:
00099                         intermediate = a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1] + a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1]
00100                         finprod = 0.5 * intermediate
00101                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * intermediate
00102                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00103                 else:
00104                     print '[ERROR]: There is a problem with the sire (ID %s) and/or dam (ID %s) of animal %s' % (pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID,pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID)
00105                     break
00106     except:
00107         a = numpy.zeros([1,1],'d')
00108 
00109     if save:
00110         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_a_matrix_','.dat')
00111         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00112         for row in xrange(l):
00113             line = ''
00114             for col in xrange(l):
00115                 if col == 0:
00116                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00117                 else:
00118                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00119             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00120             aout.write(line)
00121         aout.close()
00122 
00123     try: logging.info('Exited a_matrix()')
00124     except: pass
00125     return a

00127 ##
00128 # Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix() is a hacked version of a_matrix()
00129 # modified to try and improve performance.  Lists of animal, sire, and dam IDs are formed and accessed rather
00130 # than myped as it is much faster to access a member of a simple list rather than an attribute of an object in a
00131 # list.  Further note that only the diagonal and upper off-diagonal of A are populated.  This is done to save
00132 # n(n+1) / 2 matrix writes.  For a 1000-element array, this saves 500,500 writes.
00133 # @param pedigree A PyPedal pedigree.
00134 # @param pedopts PyPedal options.
00135 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00136 # @param method Use dense or sparse matrix storage.
00137 # @param debug Print NRM for debugging
00138 # @param fill Fill both the upper and lower off-diagonals when 1, only the upper otherwise.
00139 # @retval The NRM as Numarray matrix.
00140 #@profile
00141 def fast_a_matrix(pedigree, pedopts, save=0, method='dense', debug=0, fill=1):
00142     """
00143     Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix() is a hacked
00144     version of a_matrix() modified to try and improve performance.  Lists of animal,
00145     sire, and dam IDs are formed and accessed rather than myped as it is much faster to
00146     access a member of a simple list rather than an attribute of an object in a
00147     list.  Further note that only the diagonal and upper off-diagonal of A are
00148     populated.  This is done to save n(n+1) / 2 matrix writes.  For a 1000-element
00149     array, this saves 500,500 writes.
00150     """
00151 #     try: logging.info('Entered fast_a_matrix()')
00152 #     except: pass
00153 #     print '\t\t\tEntered pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00154 #    print 'Entered pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00155 #    print pedopts
00156 #    print '[DEBUG]: method = ', method
00157 
00158     # Check the foundercoi flag and do what it says.
00159     foundercoi = int(pedopts['foundercoi'])
00160     # Check to make sure that foundercoi is either 0 or 1.
00161     if foundercoi not in [0, 1]: foundercoi = 0
00162 
00163     _animals = {}
00164     _sires = {}
00165     _dams = {}
00166     _str_sires = {}
00167     _str_dams = {}
00168     l = len(pedigree)
00169     #method = 'dense'
00170     if method not in ['dense','sparse']:
00171         method = 'dense'
00172     #try:
00173     # Use PySparse to provide sparse matrix storage for large
00174     # relationship matrices.
00175     if method == 'sparse':
00176         try:
00177 #            from pysparse import spmatrix
00178             a = spmatrix.ll_mat_sym(l*l)
00179             for i in xrange(l):
00180                 a[i,i] = 1.
00181         except:
00182 #            logging.error('Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse! Using NumPY dense matrices instead.')
00183 #            print '[ERROR]: Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse! Using NumPY dense matrices instead.'
00184             a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00185     # Otherwise, use Numpy and its dense matrices
00186     else:
00187         a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate
00188         # print a
00189     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00190         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Started forming animal, sire, and dam lists at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00191     #print '\tIdx\tID\tName'
00192     for i in xrange(l):
00193     a[i,i] = 1.0
00194     if foundercoi == 1:
00195             if str(pedigree[i].sireID) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(pedigree[i].damID) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00196                 a[i,i] = 1.0 + pedigree[i].fa
00197         try:
00198             _a = _animals[i]
00199         except KeyError:
00200             _animals[i] = int(pedigree[i].animalID)
00201             #print 'A:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].animalID, '\t', pedigree[i].name
00202         try:
00203             _s = _sires[i]
00204         except KeyError:
00205             _sires[i] = int(pedigree[i].sireID)
00206         _str_sires[i] = str(_sires[i])
00207             #print 'S:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].sireID, '\t', pedigree[i].sireName
00208         try:
00209             _d = _dams[i]
00210         except KeyError:
00211             _dams[i] = int(pedigree[i].damID)
00212             _str_dams[i] = str(_dams[i])
00213             #print 'D:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].damID, '\t', pedigree[i].damName
00214     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00215         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Finished forming animal, sire, and dam lists at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00216         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Started computing A at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00217     #print '_animals: ', _animals
00218     #print '_sires: ', _sires
00219     #print '_dams: ', _dams
00220     #print 'missing_parent: ', pedopts['missing_parent']
00221     #print l
00222     this_msg = str(pedopts['missing_parent'])
00223     for row in xrange(l):
00224         for col in xrange(row,l):
00225             if _str_sires[col] != this_msg and _str_dams[col] != this_msg:
00226                 # both parents known
00227                 if row == col:
00228                     a[row,col] = a[row,col] + ( 0.5 * a[_sires[col]-1,_dams[col]-1] )
00229                 else:
00230                     a[row,col] = 0.5 * ( a[row,_sires[col]-1] + a[row,_dams[col]-1] )
00231                     a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00232             else:
00233                 if _str_sires[col] == this_msg and _str_dams[col] == this_msg:
00234                     # sire and dam unknown
00235                     pass
00236                 elif _str_sires[col] == this_msg and _str_dams[col] != this_msg:
00237                     # sire unknown, dam known
00238                     if row != col:
00239                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,_dams[col]-1]
00240                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00241         else:
00242                     # sire known, dam unknown
00243                     if row != col:
00244                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,_sires[col]-1]
00245                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00246     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00247         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Finished computing A at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00248     #except:
00249     #    a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate order
00250 
00251     if save == 1:
00252         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedopts['filetag'],'_new_a_matrix_','.dat')
00253         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00254         label = 'Produced by pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()\n'
00255         aout.write(label)
00256         for row in xrange(l):
00257             line = ''
00258             for col in xrange(l):
00259                 if col == 0:
00260                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00261                 else:
00262                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00263             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00264             aout.write(line)
00265         aout.close()
00266 
00267 #     try: logging.info('Exited fast_a_matrix()')
00268 #     except: pass
00269 #     print '\t\t\tExited pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00270     if debug:
00271         print a
00272     return a

00274 ##
00275 # Form a relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix_r() differs from fast_a_matrix() in that the
00276 # coefficients of relationship are corrected for the inbreeding of the parents.
00277 # @param pedigree A PyPedal pedigree.
00278 # @param pedopts PyPedal options.
00279 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00280 # @param method Use dense or sparse matrix storage.
00281 # @retval A relationship as Numarray matrix.
00282 def fast_a_matrix_r(pedigree, pedopts, save=0, method='dense'):
00283     """
00284     Form a relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix_r() differs from
00285     fast_a_matrix() in that the coefficients of relationship are corrected for the
00286     inbreeding of the parents.
00287     """
00288     #try: logging.info('Entered fast_a_matrix_r()')
00289     #except: pass
00290     import math   # We need it for sqrt()
00291     animals = []
00292     sires = []
00293     dams = []
00294     #print pedigree
00295     l = len(pedigree)
00296     #method = 'dense'
00297     if method not in ['dense','sparse']:
00298         method = 'dense'
00299     try:
00300         # Use PySparse to provide sparse matrix storage for large
00301         # relationship matrices.
00302         if method == 'sparse':
00303             try:
00304                 a = spmatrix.ll_mat_sym(l*l)
00305                 for i in xrange(l):
00306                     a[i,i] = 1.
00307             except:
00308                 a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00309         # Otherwise, use NumPy and its dense matrices
00310         else:
00311             a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00312         for i in xrange(l):
00313             animals.append(int(pedigree[i].animalID))
00314             sires.append(int(pedigree[i].sireID))
00315             dams.append(int(pedigree[i].damID))
00316         # Poorly-written code -- loops twice.  Once to compute CoI and a second time to
00317         # correct CoR for parental inbreeding.
00318         for row in xrange(l):
00319             for col in xrange(row,l):
00320                 #print '[DEBUG]: row = %s\tcol = %s' % (row,col)
00321                 if str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00322                     if row == col:
00323                         # both parents unknown and assumed unrelated
00324                         a[row,col] = 1.
00325                 elif str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00326                     # sire unknown, dam known
00327                     if row == col:
00328                         a[row,col] = 1.
00329                     else:
00330                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,dams[col]-1]
00331                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00332                 elif str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00333                     # sire known, dam unknown
00334                     if row == col:
00335                         a[row,col] = 1.
00336                     else:
00337                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,sires[col]-1]
00338                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00339                 elif sires[col] != pedopts['missing_parent'] and dams[col] != pedopts['missing_parent']:
00340                     # both parents known
00341                     if row == col:
00342                         a[row,col] = 1. + ( 0.5 * a[sires[col]-1,dams[col]-1] )
00343                     else:
00344                         intermediate = a[row,sires[col]-1] + a[row,dams[col]-1]
00345                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * intermediate
00346                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00347                 else:
00348                     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00349                         print '[ERROR]: There is a problem with the sire (ID %s) and/or dam (ID %s) of animal %s' % (pedigree[col].sireID, pedigree[col].damID, pedigree[col].animalID)
00350                     break
00351         for row in xrange(l):
00352             for col in xrange(row,l):
00353                 if str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00354                     pass
00355                 elif str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00356                     # sire unknown, dam known
00357                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00358                         numerator = 0.5 * a[row,dams[col]-1]
00359                         denominator = sqrt ( a[dams[col]-1,dams[col]-1] )
00360                         try:
00361                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00362                         except:
00363                             coefficient = 0.
00364                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00365                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00366                 elif str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00367                     # sire known, dam unknown
00368                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00369                         numerator = 0.5 * a[row,sires[col]-1]
00370                         denominator = sqrt ( a[sires[col]-1,sires[col]-1] )
00371                         try:
00372                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00373                         except:
00374                             coefficient = 0.
00375                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00376                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00377                 elif sires[col] != pedopts['missing_parent'] and dams[col] != pedopts['missing_parent']:
00378                     # both parents known
00379                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00380                         numerator = 0.5 * ( a[row,sires[col]-1] + a[row,dams[col]-1] )
00381                         denominator = math.sqrt ( ( a[sires[col]-1,sires[col]-1] ) * ( a[dams[col]-1,dams[col]-1] ) )
00382                         try:
00383                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00384                         except:
00385                             coefficient = 0.
00386                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00387                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00388                 else:
00389                     pass
00390     except:
00391         a = numpy.zeros([1,1],'d')
00392     # print a
00393     if save == 1:
00394         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_a_matrix_r_','.dat')
00395         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00396         label = 'Produced by pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix_r()\n'
00397         aout.write(label)
00398         for row in xrange(l):
00399             line = ''
00400             for col in xrange(l):
00401                 if col == 0:
00402                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00403                 else:
00404                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00405             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00406             aout.write(line)
00407         aout.close()
00408 
00409     #try: logging.info('Exited fast_a_matrix_r()')
00410     #except: pass
00411     return a

00413 ##
00414 # inbreeding() is a proxy function used to dispatch pedigrees to the appropriate
00415 # function for computing CoI.  By default, small pedigrees < 10,000 animals) are
00416 # processed with the tabular method directly.  For larger pedigrees, or if requested,
00417 # the recursive method of VanRaden (1992) is used.
00418 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00419 # @param method Keyword indicating which method of computing CoI should be used (tabular|vanraden).
00420 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0, which uses the complete pedigree.
00421 # @param rels Flag indicating whether or not summary statistics should be computed for coefficients of relationship.
00422 # @param output Flag indicating whether or not output files should be written.
00423 # @param force Flag to override use of NRM attached to pedigree for finding COI (0: use NRM, 1: ignore NRM)
00424 # @retval A dictionary of CoI keyed to renumbered animal IDs.
00425 #@profile
00426 def inbreeding(pedobj, method='tabular', gens=0, rels=0, output=1, force=0):
00427     """
00428     inbreeding() is a proxy function used to dispatch pedigrees to the appropriate
00429     function for computing CoI.  By default, small pedigrees < 10,000 animals) are
00430     processed with the tabular method directly.  For larger pedigrees, or if requested,
00431     the recursive method of VanRaden (1992) is used.
00432     """
00433     try: logging.info('Entered inbreeding()')
00434     except: pass
00435     fx = {}
00436     metadata = {}
00437     if method not in ['vanraden','tabular','meu_luo', 'mod_meu_luo']:
00438         try: logging.warning('You passed an unrecognized method, %s, to pyp_nrm/inbreeding(); the method was changed to the default of \'tabular\'.', method)
00439         except: pass
00440         method = 'tabular'
00441     if int(gens) < 0:
00442         try: logging.warning('You passed an invalid value of gens, %s, to pyp_nrm/inbreeding(); gens was changed to the default of 0.', gens)
00443         except: pass
00444         gens = 0
00445 
00446     if rels:
00447         rel_dict = {}
00448         #rel_dict['r_count'] = 0
00449         rel_dict['r_count'] = (pedobj.metadata.num_records*(pedobj.metadata.num_records+1))/2
00450         rel_dict['r_nonzero_count'] = 0
00451         rel_dict['r_min'] = 0.
00452         rel_dict['r_max'] = 0.
00453         rel_dict['r_rng'] = 0.
00454         rel_dict['r_avg'] = 0.
00455         rel_dict['r_nonzero_avg'] = 0.
00456         rel_dict['r_sum'] = 0.
00457         rel_dict['r_nonzero_sum'] = 0.
00458 
00459         reldict = {}
00460         reldict['r_count'] = 0
00461         reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = 0
00462         reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] = 0.
00463         reldict['r_max'] = 0.
00464         reldict['r_min'] = 1.
00465         reldict['r_sum'] = 0.
00466 
00467     # If the user has already computed the NRM for this pedigree we will use it
00468     # to get the COI rather than recompute it all over again.
00469     if pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and pedobj.nrm.nrm.shape[0] == pedobj.metadata.num_records and force == 0:
00470         try: logging.info('pyp_nrm/inbreeding() is using the NRM attached to the pedigree to get COI.')
00471         except: pass
00472         for _i in xrange(pedobj.metadata.num_records):
00473             fx[pedobj.pedigree[_i].animalID] = pedobj.nrm.nrm[_i][_i] - 1.
00474         if rels == 1:
00475             n = pedobj.nrm.nrm.shape[0]
00476             reldict['r_count'] = ( n * ( n + 1 ) ) / 2
00477             for i in xrange(n):
00478                 for j in xrange (i, n):
00479                     if i != j:
00480                         if pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j] > 0.:
00481                             reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = \
00482                                 reldict['r_nonzero_count'] + 1
00483                             reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] = reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] + \
00484                                 pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j]
00485                             if pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j] > reldict['r_max']:
00486                                 reldict['r_max'] = pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j]
00487                             if pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j] < reldict['r_min']:
00488                                 reldict['r_min'] = pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j]
00489                         reldict['r_sum'] = reldict['r_sum'] + pedobj.nrm.nrm[i][j]
00490             #print '[DEBUG]: reldict: ', reldict
00491     else:
00492         if method == 'vanraden':# or pedobj.metadata.num_records > 1000:
00493             #if pedobj.metadata.num_records > 1000:
00494             #    try: logging.warning('pyp_nrm.inbreeding() dispatched the pedigree %s to pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden() because it contains more than 1000 records.', pedobj.kw['pedname'])
00495             #    except: pass
00496             if rels:
00497                 fx, reldict = inbreeding_vanraden(pedobj, gens=gens, rels=rels)
00498                 #print '[DEBUG]: reldict: ', reldict
00499             else:
00500                 fx = inbreeding_vanraden(pedobj, gens=gens)
00501     elif method == 'meu_luo':
00502         if rels != 0:
00503         logging.warning('You asked pyp_nrm.inbreeding() to compute relationships as well as inbreeding, but requested method %s, which does not provide coefficients of relationship. Only coefficients of inbreeding will be returned.', method)
00504         fx = inbreeding_meuwissen_luo(pedobj, gens=gens, rels=rels)
00505         elif method == 'mod_meu_luo':
00506             if rels != 0:
00507                 logging.warning('You asked pyp_nrm.inbreeding() to compute relationships as well as inbreeding, but requested method %s, which does not provide coefficients of relationship. Only coefficients of inbreeding will be returned.', method)
00508             fx = inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo(pedobj, gens=gens, rels=rels)
00509         else:
00510             if rels:
00511                 fx, reldict = inbreeding_tabular(pedobj, gens=gens, rels=rels)
00512                 #print '[DEBUG]: reldict: ', reldict
00513             else:
00514                 fx = inbreeding_tabular(pedobj, gens=gens)
00515     # Write summary stats to a file.
00516     if output:
00517         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_inbreeding','.dat')
00518         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00519         aout.write('# Inbreeding coefficients\n')
00520         # If the pedigree uses names do the same in the output file because
00521         # the original IDs won't mean anything when compared to the input
00522         # pedugree.
00523         if 'ASD' in pedobj.kw['pedformat']:
00524             aout.write('# Name\tRenum ID\tf_x\n')
00525         else:
00526             aout.write('# Orig ID\tRenum ID\tf_x\n')
00527     f_sum = 0.0
00528     f_min = 999.0
00529     f_max = -999.0
00530     f_nonzero_sum = 0.0
00531     f_nonzero_min = 999.0
00532     f_nonzero_max = -999.0
00533     f_nonzero_count = 0
00534     for k, v in fx.iteritems():
00535         if output:
00536             if 'ASD' in pedobj.kw['pedformat']:
00537                 aout.write('%s\t%s\t%s\n'%(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].name,k,v))
00538             else:
00539                 aout.write('%s\t%s\t%s\n'%(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].originalID,k,v))
00540         # Update self.fa for each Animal object in the pedigree.
00541         pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].fa = v
00542         f_sum = f_sum + v
00543         if v > f_max:
00544             f_max = v
00545         if v < f_min:
00546             f_min = v
00547         if v > 0.:
00548             f_nonzero_count = f_nonzero_count + 1
00549             f_nonzero_sum = f_nonzero_sum + v
00550             if v > f_nonzero_max:
00551                 f_nonzero_max = v
00552             if v < f_nonzero_min:
00553                 f_nonzero_min = v
00554     if len(fx.keys()) == 0:
00555         f_rng = 0.
00556         f_avg = 0.
00557         f_min = 0.
00558         f_max = 0.
00559     else:
00560         f_avg = f_sum / len(fx.keys())
00561         f_rng = f_max - f_min
00562     # If there are no inbred animals in the pedigree we need
00563     # to make sure that meaningful values are returned, rather
00564     # that, e.g., -999.
00565     if f_nonzero_count == 0:
00566         f_nonzero_rng = 0.
00567         f_nonzero_avg = 0.
00568         f_nonzero_min = 0.
00569         f_nonzero_max = 0.
00570     else:
00571         f_nonzero_rng = f_nonzero_max - f_nonzero_min
00572         f_nonzero_avg = f_nonzero_sum / f_nonzero_count
00573     # Summary statistics including all CoI
00574     metadata['all'] = {}
00575     metadata['all']['f_count'] = len(fx.keys())
00576     metadata['all']['f_sum'] = f_sum
00577     metadata['all']['f_min'] = f_min
00578     metadata['all']['f_max'] = f_max
00579     metadata['all']['f_rng'] = f_rng
00580     metadata['all']['f_avg'] = f_avg
00581     # Summary statistics including only nonzero CoI
00582     metadata['nonzero'] = {}
00583     metadata['nonzero']['f_count'] = f_nonzero_count
00584     metadata['nonzero']['f_sum'] = f_nonzero_sum
00585     metadata['nonzero']['f_min'] = f_nonzero_min
00586     metadata['nonzero']['f_max'] = f_nonzero_max
00587     metadata['nonzero']['f_rng'] = f_nonzero_rng
00588     metadata['nonzero']['f_avg'] = f_nonzero_avg
00589 
00590     if rels:
00591     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages'] == 1: print '[DEBUG]: reldict: ', reldict
00592         if reldict['r_count'] > 0:
00593             if reldict['r_min'] < rel_dict['r_min']:
00594                 rel_dict['r_min'] = reldict['r_min']
00595             if reldict['r_max'] > rel_dict['r_max']:
00596                 rel_dict['r_max'] = reldict['r_max']
00597             rel_dict['r_rng'] = rel_dict['r_max'] - rel_dict['r_min']
00598             rel_dict['r_sum'] = reldict['r_sum'] + reldict['r_sum']
00599             rel_dict['r_avg'] = rel_dict['r_sum'] / rel_dict['r_count']
00600         if reldict['r_nonzero_count'] > 0:
00601             rel_dict['r_nonzero_count'] = reldict['r_nonzero_count'] + rel_dict['r_nonzero_count']
00602             rel_dict['r_nonzero_sum'] = rel_dict['r_nonzero_sum'] + reldict['r_nonzero_sum']
00603             rel_dict['r_nonzero_avg'] = rel_dict['r_nonzero_sum'] / rel_dict['r_nonzero_count']
00604         #print '\n\nrel_dct: %s\n\n' % ( rel_dict )
00605 
00606     if output:
00607         line = '='*80
00608         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00609         aout.write('Inbreeding Statistics\n')
00610         line = '-'*80
00611         aout.write('All animals:\n')
00612         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00613         aout.write('\tCount:\t%s\n'%len(fx.keys()))
00614         aout.write('\tMean:\t%s\n'%f_avg)
00615         aout.write('\tMin:\t%s\n'%f_min)
00616         aout.write('\tMax:\t%s\n'%f_max)
00617         line = '-'*80
00618         aout.write('Animals with non-zero CoI:\n')
00619         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00620         aout.write('\tCount:\t%s\n'%f_nonzero_count)
00621         aout.write('\tMean:\t%s\n'%f_nonzero_avg)
00622         aout.write('\tMin:\t%s\n'%f_nonzero_min)
00623         aout.write('\tMax:\t%s\n'%f_nonzero_max)
00624         aout.close()
00625 
00626     try: logging.info('Exited inbreeding()')
00627     except: pass
00628 
00629     pedobj.kw['f_computed'] = 1
00630     out_dict = {}
00631     out_dict['metadata'] = metadata
00632     out_dict['fx'] = fx
00633     if rels:
00634         return out_dict, rel_dict
00635     else:
00636         return out_dict
00637 
00638 ##
00639 # inbreeding_vanraden() uses VanRaden's (1992) method for computing coefficients of
00640 # inbreeding in a large pedigree.  The method works as follows:
00641 #   1.  Take a large pedigree and order it from youngest animal to oldest (n, n-1, ..., 1);
00642 #   2.  Recurse through the pedigree to find all of the ancestors of that animal n;
00643 #   3.  Reorder and renumber that "subpedigree";
00644 #   4.  Compute coefficients of inbreeding for that "subpedigree" using the tabular
00645 #       method (Emik and Terrill, 1949);
00646 #   5.  Put the coefficients of inbreeding in a dictionary;
00647 #   6.  Repeat 2 - 5 for animals n-1 through 1; the process is slowest for the early
00648 #       pedigrees and fastest for the later pedigrees.
00649 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00650 # @param cleanmaps Flag to denote whether or not subpedigree ID maps should be deleted after they are used (0|1).
00651 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0, which uses the complete pedigree.
00652 # @param rels Flag indicating whether or not summary statistics should be computed for coefficients of relationship.
00653 # @retval A dictionary of CoI keyed to renumbered animal IDs
00654 #@profile
00655 def inbreeding_vanraden(pedobj, cleanmaps=1, gens=0, rels=0):
00656     """
00657     inbreeding_vanraden() uses VanRaden's (1992) method for computing coefficients of
00658     inbreeding in a large pedigree.  The method works as follows:
00659     1.  Take a large pedigree and order it from youngest animal to oldest (n, n-1, ...,
00660         1);
00661     2.  Recurse through the pedigree to find all of the ancestors of that animal n;
00662     3.  Reorder and renumber that "subpedigree";
00663     4.  Compute coefficients of inbreeding for that "subpedigree" using the tabular
00664         method (Emik and Terrill, 1949);
00665     5.  Put the coefficients of inbreeding in a dictionary;
00666     6.  Repeat 2 - 5 for animals n-1 through 1; the process is slowest for the early
00667         pedigrees and fastest for the later pedigrees.
00668     """
00669     try: logging.info('Entered inbreeding_vanraden()')
00670     except: pass
00671 
00672     #print 'Entered inbreeding_vanraden()'
00673     #print '\tConverting pedigree to graph.'
00674     from PyPedal import pyp_network
00675     # Using pyp_network.ped_to_graph() instead of pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree()
00676     # provides a gain in performance of at least an order of magnitude.
00677     ng = pyp_network.ped_to_graph(pedobj)
00678 
00679     _ped = []       # This is a temporary pedigree
00680     top_ped = []
00681 
00682     if int(gens) > 0:
00683 #         print 'gens: %s' % ( gens )
00684         top_peddict = pyp_network.find_ancestors_g(ng, len(pedobj.idmap), {}, gens)
00685         top_peddict[len(pedobj.idmap)] = 1
00686         top_ped = top_peddict.keys()
00687         #print 'top_ped: ', top_ped
00688         top_r = []
00689         _anids = []
00690         for _j in top_ped:
00691             # Make sure that we only include animals from the user-
00692             # specified generations.
00693             if top_peddict[_j] <= gens:
00694                 top_r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(_j)-1]))
00695                 # Animals in the earliest generation need to have
00696                 # their sire and dam IDs set to unknown.
00697                 if top_peddict[_j] == 1:
00698                     top_r[-1].sireID = 0
00699                     top_r[-1].damID = 0
00700                 _anids.append(top_r[-1].animalID)
00701     else:
00702         _anids = pedobj.backmap.keys()     # Distinct animal IDs in the pedigree
00703 
00704     fx = {}         # This will hold our coefficients of inbreeding
00705     _parents = {}   # Stores a list of sire-dam pairs along with the youngest offspring
00706                     # of that pair.  Used as a lookup table to avoid lots of redundant
00707                     # calculations for full-sibs.
00708     _anids.sort()       # sort from oldest to youngest
00709     _anids.reverse()    # reverse the list to put the youngest animals first
00710     _counter = 0
00711     _cum_f_counter = 0
00712     _vanraden_round = 0
00713     _cum_pct_proc = 0.
00714     _related = {}   # Dictionary for looking-up animals with non-zero
00715                     # relationships.
00716 
00717     # If the user wants summary stats on coefficients of relationship,
00718     # prepare the dictionary, counters, and accumulators.
00719     if rels:
00720         reldict = {}
00721         reldict['r_count'] = 0
00722         reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = 0
00723         reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] = 0.
00724         reldict['r_max'] = 0.
00725         reldict['r_min'] = 1.
00726         reldict['r_sum'] = 0.
00727         #print '[DEBUG]: inbreeding_vanraden(): reldict: ', reldict
00728     #print '_anids: ', _anids
00729 
00730     for i in _anids:
00731         #print '\t_anid: ', i
00732         if int(gens) == 0:
00733             _parent_key = '%s_%s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[int(i)-1].sireID,
00734                 pedobj.pedigree[int(i)-1].damID )
00735         else:
00736             _parent_key = '%s_%s' % ( top_r[top_peddict[int(i)]].sireID, top_r[top_peddict[int(i)]].damID )
00737         try:
00738             _k = fx[i]  # If an exception is thrown, an animal is not in the
00739                         # dictionary yet.
00740         except KeyError:
00741             try:
00742                 # If the parental combination has been seen already then we
00743                 # already know the COI of the mating and do not need to do
00744                 # the calculations again.
00745                 #print '_parent_key: ', _parent_key
00746                 #print 'fx[_parents[_parent_key]]: ', fx[_parents[_parent_key]]
00747                 fx[i] = fx[_parents[_parent_key]]
00748             except:
00749                 #print '\tAnimal %s not in inbreeding dict' % ( i )
00750                 _f_counter = 0
00751                 _vanraden_round = _vanraden_round + 1
00752                 if _vanraden_round == 1:
00753                     try: logging.info('Starting round %s of pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden().', _vanraden_round)
00754                     except: pass
00755                 _tag = '%s_%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],i)
00756                 if int(gens) > 0:
00757                     _ped = top_peddict
00758                 else:
00759                     _ped = pyp_network.find_ancestors(ng, i, [])
00760                     _ped.append(i)
00761                 #print 'ped len: %d' % ( len(_ped) )
00762                 #print 'ped: %s' % ( _ped )
00763                 if int(gens) > 0:
00764                     _r = top_r
00765                 else:
00766                     _r = []     # This list will hold a copy of the objects in _ped
00767                                 # so that we can renumber animal i's pedigree without
00768                                 # changing the data in pedobj.pedigree.
00769                     _map = {}
00770                     for j in _ped:
00771                         # This is VERY important -- rather than append a reference
00772                         # to _ped[j-1] to _r we need to append a COPY of _ped[j-1]
00773                         # to _r.  If you change this code and get rid of the call to
00774                         # copy.copy() then things will not work correctly.  You will
00775                         # realize what you have done when your renumberings seem to
00776                         # be spammed.
00777                         _r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(j)-1]))
00778                 # We also need to honor the slow_reorder option.
00779                 if pedobj.kw['slow_reorder']:
00780                     _r = pyp_utils.reorder(_r,_tag)      # Reorder the pedigree
00781                 else:
00782                     _r = pyp_utils.fast_reorder(_r,_tag)      # Reorder the pedigree
00783                 _s, _map = pyp_utils.renumber(_r,_tag, returnmap=1, debug=pedobj.kw['debug_messages'],animaltype=pedobj.kw['animal_type'])  # Renumber the pedigree
00784                 # _map maps IDs from original IDs to renumbered IDs.
00785                 # _backmap allows renumbered ID => original ID reverse lookups.
00786                 _backmap = {}
00787                 for _mk, _mv in _map.iteritems():
00788                     _backmap[_mv] = _mk
00789                 # There is a potential error lurking here!  The filetag passed to
00790                 # fast_a_matrix as "_tag" is expected to be a pedoptions dictionary.
00791                 # Hm...I think that passing a copy of the kw dictionary from pedobj
00792                 # with the filetag changed as appropriate will do the trick.
00793                 _opts = copy.copy(pedobj.kw)
00794                 _opts['filetag'] = _tag
00795                 # We need to accomodate the 'nrm_method' option, too.  The need for
00796                 # this is clearly demonstrated by horse.ped in the examples/ subdirectory -
00797                 # the inbreeding is so intense in that pedigree that four of the animals
00798                 # have r_xy >= 1. if we do not adjust the elements of A for parental in-
00799                 # breeding.
00800                 if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
00801                     _a = fast_a_matrix(_s,_opts,method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])     # Form the NRM w/the tabular method
00802                 else:
00803                     _a = fast_a_matrix_r(_s,_opts,method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
00804                 #print 'len(_ped): ', len(_ped)
00805                 for j in xrange(len(_ped)):
00806                     _orig_id = _backmap[_s[j].animalID]
00807                     # The same animal can appear in many different pedigrees, but
00808                     # it should always have the same CoI.  We don't want to waste
00809                     # a lot of time writing the same value to a dictionary many
00810                     # times, so we are going to check and see if the animal already
00811                     # has an entry in the CoI dictionary.  It it does, do not write
00812                     # to it again.
00813                     try:
00814                         _check = fx[_orig_id]
00815                     except KeyError:
00816                         #print _a
00817                         fx[_orig_id] = _a[j][j] - 1.
00818                         _f_counter = _f_counter + 1
00819                     if rels:
00820                         for k in xrange(j, len(_ped)):
00821                             if j != k:
00822                                 _rxykey = '%s_%s' % (_backmap[_s[j].animalID], \
00823                                     _backmap[_s[k].animalID])
00824                                 if _a[j][k] > 0.:
00825                                     try:
00826                                         _rxy = _related[_rxykey]
00827                                     except KeyError:
00828                                         _related[_rxykey] = _a[j][k]
00829                                     reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = \
00830                                         reldict['r_nonzero_count'] + 1
00831                                     reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] = \
00832                                         reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] + _a[j][k]
00833                                     if _a[j][k] > reldict['r_max']:
00834                                         reldict['r_max'] = _a[j][k]
00835                                     if _a[j][k] < reldict['r_min']:
00836                                         reldict['r_min'] = _a[j][k]
00837                                 reldict['r_count'] = reldict['r_count'] + 1
00838                                 reldict['r_sum'] = reldict['r_sum'] + _a[j][k]
00839                     try:
00840                         _ptest = _parents[_parent_key]
00841                     except KeyError:
00842                         #_parents[_parent_key] = _orig_id
00843                         _parents[_parent_key] = _parent_key
00844                     # We only got into this loop because this combination of  parents
00845                     # did not have an entry in fx, so put one there.
00846                     fx[_parent_key] = fx[_orig_id]
00847                     #print 'Parent combination: ', _parent_key, '\t\tf: ', fx[_parent_key]
00848                 #print '\n\n', reldict, '\n\n'
00849                 #print '_related (%d): %s' % ( len(_related), _related )
00850 
00851                 if cleanmaps:               # Clean up the subpedigree ID maps that we are
00852                     pyp_utils.delete_id_map(_tag)     # not going to use again.
00853                 _map = {}               # Empty our working dictionary and lists
00854                 _a = []
00855                 _s = []
00856                 _r = []
00857                 _ped = []
00858                 _pct_proc = float(_f_counter) / float(pedobj.metadata.num_records)
00859                 _cum_pct_proc = _cum_pct_proc + _pct_proc
00860                 _cum_f_counter = _cum_f_counter + _f_counter
00861     #             if _pct_proc > 0.01:
00862     #            if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00863                     #print'%s of animals processed in round %s of #pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden().' % (_pct_proc,_vanraden_round)
00864                     #print'%s of all animals have been processed in #pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden().' % (_cum_pct_proc)
00865                 #try: logging.info('%s of animals processed in round %s of #pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden().', _pct_proc, _vanraden_round)
00866                 #except: pass
00867                 logging.info('%s pct (%s) of all animals have been processed in pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden().', _cum_pct_proc, _cum_f_counter)
00868             _counter = _counter + 1
00869 
00870     # Clean-up the parent-combination entries from fx
00871     for k in _parents.keys():
00872         del fx[k]
00873 
00874     try:logging.info('Exited inbreeding_vanraden()')
00875     except: pass
00876 #     print fx
00877     if rels:
00878         return fx, reldict
00879     else:
00880         return fx
00881 
00882 ##
00883 # recurse_pedigree() performs the recursion needed to build the subpedigrees used by
00884 # inbreeding_vanraden().  For the animal with animalID anid recurse_pedigree() will
00885 # recurse through the pedigree myped and add references to the relatives of anid to
00886 # the temporary pedigree, _ped.
00887 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree.
00888 # @param anid The ID of the animal whose relatives are being located.
00889 # @param _ped A temporary PyPedal pedigree that stores references to relatives of anid.
00890 # @retval A list of references to the relatives of anid contained in myped.
00891 def recurse_pedigree(pedobj, anid, _ped):
00892     """
00893     recurse_pedigree() performs the recursion needed to build the subpedigrees used by
00894     inbreeding_vanraden().  For the animal with animalID anid recurse_pedigree() will
00895     recurse through the pedigree myped and add references to the relatives of anid to
00896     the temporary pedigree, _ped.
00897     """
00898     try:
00899         anid = int(anid)
00900         if anid != 0:
00901             if pedobj.pedigree[anid-1] not in _ped:
00902                 _ped.append(pedobj.pedigree[anid-1])
00903         _sire = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID
00904         _dam = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID
00905         if _sire != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00906             recurse_pedigree(pedobj,_sire,_ped)
00907         if _dam != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00908             recurse_pedigree(pedobj,_dam,_ped)
00909     except:
00910         pass
00911     return _ped
00912 
00913 ##
00914 # recurse_pedigree_n() recurses to build a pedigree of depth n.  A depth less than 1 returns
00915 # the animal whose relatives were to be identified.
00916 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree.
00917 # @param anid The ID of the animal whose relatives are being located.
00918 # @param _ped A temporary PyPedal pedigree that stores references to relatives of anid.
00919 # @param depth The depth of the pedigree to return.
00920 # @retval A list of references to the relatives of anid contained in myped.
00921 def recurse_pedigree_n(pedobj, anid, _ped, depth=3):
00922     """
00923     recurse_pedigree_n() recurses to build a pedigree of depth n.  A depth
00924     less than 1 returns the animal whose relatives were to be identified.
00925     """
00926     try:
00927         anid = int(anid)
00928         if anid != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00929             if pedobj.pedigree[anid-1] not in _ped:
00930                 _ped.append(pedobj.pedigree[anid-1])
00931         if depth > 0:
00932             _sire = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID
00933             _dam = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID
00934             if _sire != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00935                 recurse_pedigree_n(pedobj,_sire,_ped,depth-1)
00936             if _dam != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00937                 recurse_pedigree_n(pedobj,_dam,_ped,depth-1)
00938     except:
00939         pass
00940     return _ped
00941 
00942 ##
00943 # recurse_pedigree_onesided() recurses to build a subpedigree from either the sire
00944 # or dam side of a pedigree.
00945 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree.
00946 # @param side The side to build: 's' for sire and 'd' for dam.
00947 # @param anid The ID of the animal whose relatives are being located.
00948 # @param _ped A temporary PyPedal pedigree that stores references to relatives of anid.
00949 # @retval A list of references to the relatives of anid contained in myped.
00950 def recurse_pedigree_onesided(pedobj, anid, _ped, side):
00951     """
00952     recurse_pedigree_onesided() recurses to build a subpedigree from either the sire
00953     or dam side of a pedigree.
00954     """
00955     try:
00956         anid = int(anid)
00957         if anid != 0:
00958             if pedobj.pedigree[anid-1] not in _ped:
00959                 _ped.append(pedobj.pedigree[anid-1])
00960         if side == 's':
00961             _sire = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID
00962             if _sire != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00963                 recurse_pedigree(pedobj,_sire,_ped)
00964         else:
00965             _dam = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID
00966             if _dam != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00967                 recurse_pedigree(pedobj,_dam,_ped)
00968     except:
00969         pass
00970     return _ped
00971 
00972 ##
00973 # recurse_pedigree_idonly() performs the recursion needed to build subpedigrees.
00974 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree.
00975 # @param anid The ID of the animal whose relatives are being located.
00976 # @param _ped A PyPedal list that stores the animalIDs of relatives of anid.
00977 # @retval A list of animalIDs of the relatives of anid contained in myped.
00978 def recurse_pedigree_idonly(pedobj, anid, _ped):
00979     """
00980     recurse_pedigree_idonly() performs the recursion needed to build subpedigrees.
00981     """
00982     try:
00983         anid = int(anid)
00984         if anid != 0:
00985             #print '\t\tanid %s\tsireid %s\tdamid %s' % ( anid, pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID )
00986             if pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].animalID not in _ped:
00987                 _ped.append(pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].animalID)
00988         _sire = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID
00989         _dam = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID
00990         if _sire != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00991             recurse_pedigree_idonly(pedobj,_sire,_ped)
00992         if _dam != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00993             recurse_pedigree_idonly(pedobj,_dam,_ped)
00994     except:
00995         pass
00996     return _ped
00997 
00998 ##
00999 # recurse_pedigree_idonly_side() performs the recursion needed to build
01000 # a subpedigree containing only animal IDs for either all sires or all
01001 # dams.  That is, a pedigree would go sire-paternal grandsire-paternal
01002 # great-grandsire, etc.
01003 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree.
01004 # @param anid The ID of the animal whose relatives are being located.
01005 # @param _ped A PyPedal list that stores the animalIDs of relatives of anid.
01006 # @param side The side of the pedigree to follow ('s'|'d').
01007 # @retval A list of animalIDs of the relatives of anid contained in myped.
01008 def recurse_pedigree_idonly_side(pedobj, anid, _ped, side='s'):
01009     """
01010     recurse_pedigree_idonly_side() performs the recursion needed to build
01011     a subpedigree containing only animal IDs for either all sires or all
01012     dams.  That is, a pedigree would go sire-paternal grandsire-paternal
01013     great-grandsire, etc.
01014     """
01015     if side not in ['s','d']:
01016         side = 's'
01017     try:
01018         anid = int(anid)
01019         if anid != 0:
01020             if pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].animalID not in _ped:
01021                 _ped.append(pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].animalID)
01022         _sire = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].sireID
01023         _dam = pedobj.pedigree[anid-1].damID
01024         if side == 's':
01025             if _sire != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01026                 recurse_pedigree_idonly_side(pedobj,_sire,_ped,side='s')
01027         if side == 'd':
01028             if _dam != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01029                 recurse_pedigree_idonly_side(pedobj,_dam,_ped,side='d')
01030     except:
01031         pass
01032     return _ped
01033 
01034 ##
01035 # inbreeding_tabular() computes CoI using the tabular method by calling
01036 # fast_a_matrix() to form the NRM directly.  In order for this routine
01037 # to return successfully requires that you are able to allocate a matrix
01038 # of floats of dimension len(myped)**2.
01039 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01040 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0, which uses the complete pedigree.
01041 # @param rels Flag indicating whether or not summary statistics should be computed for coefficients of relationship.
01042 # @retval A dictionary of CoI keyed to renumbered animal IDs
01043 def inbreeding_tabular(pedobj, gens=0, rels=0):
01044     """
01045     inbreeding_tabular() computes CoI using the tabular method by calling
01046     fast_a_matrix() to form the NRM directly.  In order for this routine
01047     to return successfully requires that you are able to allocate a matrix
01048     of floats of dimension len(myped)**2.
01049     """
01050     try: logging.info('Entered inbreeding_tabular()')
01051     except: pass
01052 
01053     # If the user wants summary stats on coefficients of relationship,
01054     # prepare the dictionary, counters, and accumulators.
01055     if rels:
01056         reldict = {}
01057         reldict['r_count'] = 0
01058         reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = 0
01059         reldict['r_nonzero_sum'] = 0.
01060         reldict['r_max'] = 0.
01061         reldict['r_min'] = 1.
01062         reldict['r_sum'] = 0.
01063 
01064     # See pyp_nrm.inbreeding_vanraden() for detailed notes on what
01065     # the code in this loop does.
01066     if int(gens) > 0:
01067         _ped = pyp_network.find_ancestors_g(ng, i, [], gens)
01068         _ped.append(i)
01069         _a, _s, _r = [], [], []
01070         _map = {}
01071         for j in _ped:
01072             _r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(j)-1]))
01073         if pedobj.kw['slow_reorder']:
01074             _r = pyp_utils.reorder(_r,_tag)      # Reorder the pedigree
01075         else:
01076             _r = pyp_utils.fast_reorder(_r,_tag)      # Reorder the pedigree
01077         _s, _map = pyp_utils.renumber(_r,_tag, returnmap=1, debug=pedobj.kw['debug_messages'],animaltype=pedobj.kw['animal_type'])
01078         _backmap = {}
01079         for _mk, _mv in _map.iteritems():
01080             _backmap[_mv] = _mk
01081         _opts = copy.copy(pedobj.kw)
01082         _opts['filetag'] = _tag
01083         if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
01084             _a = fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
01085         else:
01086             _a = fast_a_matrix_r(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
01087         fx = {}
01088         for i in xrange(len(_ped)):
01089             fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] = _a[i][i] - 1.
01090         del(_a)
01091     else:
01092         try:
01093             if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
01094                 _a = fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree, pedobj.kw,method=pedobj. kw['matrix_type'])
01095             else:
01096                 _a = fast_a_matrix_r(pedobj.pedigree, pedobj.kw, method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
01097             fx = {}
01098             for i in xrange(pedobj.metadata.num_records):
01099                 fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] = _a[i][i] - 1.
01100                 if rels:
01101                     for j in xrange(i, pedobj.metadata.num_records):
01102                         if i != j:
01103                             if _a[i][j] > 0.:
01104                                 reldict['r_nonzero_count'] = \
01105                                     reldict['r_nonzero_count'] + 1
01106                                 if _a[i][j] > reldict['r_max']:
01107                                     reldict['r_max'] = _a[i][j]
01108                                 if _a[i][j] < reldict['r_min']:
01109                                     reldict['r_min'] = _a[i][j]
01110                             reldict['r_count'] = reldict['r_count'] + 1
01111                             reldict['r_sum'] = reldict['r_sum'] + _a[i][j]
01112             del(_a)
01113         except:
01114             pass
01115     try: logging.info('Exited inbreeding_tabular()')
01116     except: pass
01117     if rels:
01118         return fx, reldict
01119     else:
01120         return fx
01121 
01122 ##
01123 # inbreeding_meuwissen_luo() computes CoI using the method of Meuwissen and
01124 # Luo (1992). It calculates only inbreeding coefficients, not relationships.
01125 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01126 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0, which uses the complete pedigree.
01127 # @param rels Flag indicating whether or not summary statistics should be computed for coefficients of relationship.
01128 # @retval A dictionary of CoI keyed to renumbered animal IDs
01129 #@profile
01130 def inbreeding_meuwissen_luo(pedobj, gens=0,**kw):
01131     """
01132     inbreeding_meuwissen_luo() computes CoI using the method of Meuwissen and
01133     Luo (1992). It calculates only inbreeding coefficients, not relationships.
01134     This code is a pretty direct implementation of the algorithm presented on
01135     pp. 311-312 of Meuiwissen, T.H.E., and Z. Luo. 1992. Computing inbreeding
01136     coefficients in large populations. Genet. Sel. Evol. 24:305-313.
01137     """
01138     try: logging.info('Entered inbreeding_meuwissen_luo()')
01139     except: pass
01140 
01141     # Setup dictionary to accumulate coefficients of inbreeding
01142     fx = {}
01143     for p in pedobj.pedigree:
01144         fx[p.animalID] = 0.0
01145     lvec = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01146     avec = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01147     dvec = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01148 
01149     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01150         print '[DEBUG]: Starting loop over pedigree with ', len(pedobj.pedigree), ' animals'
01151     for i in xrange(len(pedobj.pedigree)):
01152         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01153         print '\t[DEBUG]: Initializing local data structures for animal %s (idx: %s)' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, i)
01154             print '\t\t[DEBUG]: a[%s] = %s' % ( i, avec[i] )
01155         anc = []
01156     lvec[:] = 0.0
01157     lvec[i] = 1.0
01158         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01159         print '\t\t[DEBUG]: l[%s] = %s' % ( i, lvec[i] )
01160     # We're using 0-indexing, so the little F0 = -1 trick that M&L use does not help us here.
01161     # Check for the most common case first -- both parents unknown
01162     if pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01163         dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID] + fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID] ) )
01164     # Then check for both parents unknown
01165     elif pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01166         dvec[i] = 1.0
01167     # Finally, deal with either a known sire, unknown dam or known dam, unknown sire.
01168     else:
01169         # The "-1.0" in the expressions below comes from M&L setting the coefficient of inbreeding for unknown parents to -1.0
01170         # in order to ensure that the within-family variance is correct.
01171         # Knwon sire, unknown dam
01172         if pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01173                 dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID] - 1.0 ) )
01174         else:
01175         dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID] - 1.0 ) )
01176         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01177         print '\t\t[DEBUG]: dvec[%s] = %s' % ( i, dvec[i] )
01178         anc.append(i)
01179         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01180         print '\t\t[DEBUG]: Starting loop over ancestor list for animal %s (idx: %s)' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID-1 )
01181     while len(anc) > 0:
01182             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01183             print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Starting ancestor list: %s' % ( anc )
01184         jidx = max(anc)             # This is the index of the ID in the pedigree
01185         j = pedobj.pedigree[jidx].animalID      # This is an animal ID
01186             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01187             print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Processing Ancestor %s (idx: %s)\tSire: %s\tDam: %s' % \
01188         ( j, jidx, pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID )
01189         if pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID-1 not in anc:
01190             anc.append(pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID-1)
01191             lvec[pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID-1] = lvec[pedobj.pedigree[jidx].sireID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvec[jidx] )
01192         if pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID-1 not in anc:
01193                 anc.append(pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID-1)
01194             lvec[pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID-1] = lvec[pedobj.pedigree[jidx].damID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvec[jidx] )
01195         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01196             print '\t\t\t\t[DEBUG]: anc      = %s' % ( anc )
01197                 print '\t\t\t\t[DEBUG]: l[%s]    = %s' % ( jidx, lvec[jidx] )
01198             print '\t\t\t\t[DEBUG]: d[%s]    = %s' % ( jidx, dvec[jidx] )
01199             print '\t\t\t\t[DEBUG]: RHS      = %s' % ( lvec[jidx] * lvec[jidx] * dvec[jidx] )
01200         avec[i] = avec[i] + lvec[jidx] * lvec[jidx] * dvec[jidx]
01201             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01202             print '\t\t\t\t[DEBUG]: avec[%s] = %s' % ( i, avec[i] )
01203         anc.remove(jidx)
01204         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01205             print '\t\t[DEBUG]: avec[%s] - 1 = %s' % ( i, avec[i]-1 )
01206     fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] = avec[i] - 1.0
01207         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01208         print '\t\t[DEBUG]: fx[%s] = %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] )
01209         print '\t[DEBUG]: Current coefficients of inbeeding: ', fx
01210     try: logging.info('Exited inbreeding_meuwissen_luo()')
01211     except: pass
01212     return fx
01213 
01214 ##
01215 # inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo() computes CoI using the method of Meuwissen and
01216 # Luo (1992). as modified by Quaas (1995). It calculates only inbreeding coefficients,
01217 # not relationships.
01218 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01219 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0, which uses the complete pedigree.
01220 # @param rels Flag indicating whether or not summary statistics should be computed for coefficients of relationship.
01221 # @retval A dictionary of CoI keyed to renumbered animal IDs
01222 #@profile
01223 def inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo(pedobj, gens=0,**kw):
01224     """
01225     inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo() computes CoI using the method of Meuwissen
01226     and Luo (1992) as modified by Quaas (1995). It calculates only inbreeding coefficients,
01227     not relationships. This code is a pretty direct implementation of the algorithm presented
01228     in Appendix B.2 of Mrode (2005). Mrode cites Quaas's method as: Quaas, R. L. 1995. Fx
01229     algorithms. An unpublished note.
01230     """
01231     try: logging.info('Entered inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo()')
01232     except: pass
01233 
01234     # Setup dictionary to accumulate coefficients of inbreeding
01235     fx = {}
01236     for p in pedobj.pedigree:
01237         fx[p.animalID] = 0.0
01238     lvecs = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01239     lvecd = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01240     avec = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01241     dvec = numpy.zeros((len(pedobj.pedigree)),'d')
01242 
01243     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '[DEBUG]: Starting loop over pedigree with ', len(pedobj.pedigree), ' animals'
01244     for i in xrange(len(pedobj.pedigree)):
01245         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t[DEBUG]: Initializing local data structures for animal %s (idx: %s)' % \
01246         ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, i)
01247         ancs = []
01248     ancd = []
01249         lvecs[:] = 0.0
01250     lvecd[:] = 0
01251 
01252         # We're using 0-indexing, so the little F0 = -1 trick that M&L use does not help us here.
01253         # Check for the most common case first -- both parents unknown
01254         if pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01255             dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID] + fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID] ) )
01256         # Then check for both parents unknown
01257         elif pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01258         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: Animal %s (idx = %s) has unknown parents' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, i )
01259             dvec[i] = 1.0
01260         # Finally, deal with either a known sire, unknown dam or known dam, unknown sire.
01261         else:
01262             # Knwon sire, unknown dam
01263             if pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01264                 dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID] - 1.0 ) )
01265         # Knowm dam, unknown sire
01266             else:
01267                 dvec[i] = 0.5 - ( 0.25 * ( fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID] - 1.0 ) )
01268         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: dvec[%s] = %s' % ( i, dvec[i] )
01269         
01270         if pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1 not in ancs:
01271         ancs.append(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1)
01272         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancs' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1 )
01273         lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1] = 1.0
01274         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecs[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1, lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1] )
01275 
01276     if pedobj.pedigree[i].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1 not in ancd:
01277             ancd.append(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1)
01278         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancd' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].damID, pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1 )
01279             lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1] = 1.0
01280         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecd[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1, lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1] )
01281 
01282     # This loop was miserable to code due in large part to the publisher's decision to use two-point italic typefaces
01283     # for setting subscripts. Thanks, CABI, that was awesome. It would have been much easier to read the text if 1) it
01284         # has been larger, and 2) it has been typeset as an algorithm using proper indentation and notation. Lesson learned:
01285     # use extreme magnification.
01286         while len(ancs) > 0 and len(ancd) > 0:
01287             j = max(ancs)
01288             k = max(ancd)
01289             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t[DEBUG]: j = %s (idx: %s)\tk = %s (idx: %s)' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].animalID, \
01290         j, pedobj.pedigree[k].animalID, k )
01291         if j > k:
01292             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Animal: %s\tSire: %s\tDam: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].animalID, \
01293             pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[j].damID )
01294         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Starting ANCS: %s' % ( ancs )
01295                 if pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 not in ancs:
01296                     ancs.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1)
01297             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancs' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID, \
01298             pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 )
01299                 lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] = lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecs[j] )
01300         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecs[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1, lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] )
01301         if pedobj.pedigree[j].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 not in ancs:
01302                     ancs.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1)
01303             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancs' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID, \
01304             pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 )
01305                 lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] = lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecs[j] )
01306         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecs[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1, lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] )
01307             ancs.remove(j)
01308         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCS: %s' % ( ancs )
01309 
01310             elif k > j:
01311         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Animal: %s\tSire: %s\tDam: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].animalID, \
01312             pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[k].damID )
01313         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Starting ANCD: %s' % ( ancd )
01314                 if pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1 not in ancd:
01315                     ancd.append(pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1)
01316             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancd' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID, \
01317             pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1 )
01318                 lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1] = lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecd[k] )
01319         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecd[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1, lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID-1] )
01320                 if pedobj.pedigree[k].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1 not in ancd:
01321                     ancd.append(pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1)
01322             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancd' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].damID, \
01323             pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1 )
01324                 lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1] = lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecd[k] )
01325         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecd[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1, lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[k].damID-1] )
01326                 ancd.remove(k)
01327         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCD: %s' % ( ancd )
01328 
01329         else:
01330         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: The next youngest ancestor, %s (idx: %s), is a common ancestor' % \
01331             ( pedobj.pedigree[j].animalID, j )
01332         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Animal: %s\tSire: %s\tDam: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[k].animalID, \
01333             pedobj.pedigree[k].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[k].damID )
01334         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCS: %s' % ( ancs )
01335         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCD: %s' % ( ancd )
01336         # If the sire is known
01337         if pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01338             if pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 not in ancs:
01339                         ancs.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1)
01340                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancs' % \
01341                 ( pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 )
01342                     lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] = lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecs[j] )
01343             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvec[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1, \
01344             lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1] )
01345             if pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 not in ancd:
01346                 ancd.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1)
01347                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancd' % \
01348                 ( pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID, pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1 )
01349                     lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] = lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecd[j] )
01350             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvec[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1, \
01351             lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].sireID-1] )
01352         # If the dam is known
01353         if pedobj.pedigree[j].damID != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01354             if pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 not in ancs:
01355                         ancs.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1)
01356                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancs' % \
01357                 ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID, pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 )
01358                     lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] = lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecs[j] )
01359                     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvec[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1, \
01360             lvecs[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] )
01361             if pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 not in ancd:
01362                         ancd.append(pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1)
01363                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Adding animal %s (idx: %s) to ancd' % \
01364                 ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID, pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1 )
01365                     lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] = lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] + ( 0.5 * lvecd[j] )
01366             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvec[%s]: %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1, \
01367             lvecd[pedobj.pedigree[j].damID-1] )
01368             fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] = fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] + ( lvecs[j] * lvecd[j] * 0.5 * dvec[j] )
01369         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: fx[%s] = %s * %s * 0.5 * %s = %s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID, \
01370             lvecs[j], lvecd[j], dvec[j], fx[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID] )
01371         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: dvec   = %s' % ( dvec )
01372         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecs  = %s' % ( lvecs )
01373         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: lvecd  = %s' % ( lvecd )
01374             ancs.remove(j)
01375         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCS: %s' % ( ancs )
01376             ancd.remove(j)
01377         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']: print '\t\t\t[DEBUG]: Ending ANCD: %s' % ( ancd )
01378 
01379     try: logging.info('Exited inbreeding_modified_meuwissen_luo()')
01380     except: pass
01381     return fx
01382 
01383 ##
01384 # Form the decomposed form of A, TDT', directly from a pedigree (after
01385 # Henderson, 1976; Thompson, 1977; Mrode, 1996).  Return D, a diagonal
01386 # matrix, and T, a lower triagular matrix such that A = TDT'.
01387 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01388 # @retval A diagonal matrix, D, and a lower triangular matrix, T.
01389 def a_decompose(pedobj):
01390     """
01391     Form the decomposed form of A, TDT', directly from a pedigree (after
01392     Henderson, 1976; Thompson, 1977; Mrode, 1996).  Return D, a diagonal
01393     matrix, and T, a lower triagular matrix such that A = TDT'.
01394     """
01395     try: logging.info('Entered a_decompose()')
01396     except: pass
01397     l = pedobj.metadata.num_records
01398 
01399     if not ( pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and pedobj.nrm.nrm.shape[0] == pedobj.metadata.num_records ):
01400         if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
01401             a = fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree, pedobj.kw, method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
01402         else:
01403             a = fast_a_matrix_r(pedobj.pedigree, pedobj.kw, method=pedobj.kw['matrix_type'])
01404     else:
01405         a = pedobj.nrm
01406 
01407     try:
01408         T = numpy.identity(l, dtype=numpy.float)
01409         D = numpy.identity(l, dtype=numpy.float)
01410         for row in xrange(l):
01411             for col in xrange(row+1):
01412                 # cast these b/c items are read from the pedigree file as characters, not  integers
01413                 pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID)
01414                 pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID)
01415                 pedobj.pedigree[col].damID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID)
01416                 if pedobj.pedigree[row].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and pedobj.pedigree[row].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01417                     if row == col:
01418                         # both parents unknown and assumed unrelated
01419                         T[row,col] = 1.
01420                         D[row,col] = 1.
01421                     else:
01422                         T[row,col] = 0.
01423                 elif pedobj.pedigree[row].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01424                     # sire unknown, dam known
01425                     if row == col:
01426                         T[row,col] = 1.
01427                         fd = a[pedobj.pedigree[row].damID-1,pedobj.pedigree[row].damID-1] - 1.
01428                         D[row,col] = 0.75 - ( 0.5 * fd )
01429                     else:
01430                         T[row,col] = 0.5 * T[pedobj.pedigree[row].damID-1,col]
01431                 elif pedobj.pedigree[row].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
01432                     # sire known, dam unknown
